speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: ACT V

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: SCENE I. Rome. A public place.

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: Enter MENENIUS, COMINIUS, SICINIUS, BRUTUS, and others

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: No, I'll not go: you hear what he hath said

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Which was sometime his general; who loved him

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: In a most dear particular. He call'd me father:

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: But what o' that? Go, you that banish'd him;

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: A mile before his tent fall down, and knee

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: The way into his mercy: nay, if he coy'd

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: To hear Cominius speak, I'll keep at home.

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: He would not seem to know me.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Do you hear?

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Yet one time he did call me by my name:

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: I urged our old acquaintance, and the drops

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: That we have bled together. Coriolanus

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: He would not answer to: forbad all names;

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: He was a kind of nothing, titleless,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Till he had forged himself a name o' the fire

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Of burning Rome.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Why, so: you have made good work!

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: A pair of tribunes that have rack'd for Rome,

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: To make coals cheap,--a noble memory!

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: I minded him how royal 'twas to pardon

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: When it was less expected: he replied,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: It was a bare petition of a state

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: To one whom they had punish'd.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Very well:

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Could he say less?

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: I offer'd to awaken his regard

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: For's private friends: his answer to me was,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: He could not stay to pick them in a pile

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Of noisome musty chaff: he said 'twas folly,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: For one poor grain or two, to leave unburnt,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: And still to nose the offence.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: For one poor grain or two!

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: I am one of those; his mother, wife, his child,

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: And this brave fellow too, we are the grains:

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: You are the musty chaff; and you are smelt

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Above the moon: we must be burnt for you.

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Nay, pray, be patient: if you refuse your aid

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: In this so never-needed help, yet do not

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Upbraid's with our distress. But, sure, if you

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Would be your country's pleader, your good tongue,

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: More than the instant army we can make,

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Might stop our countryman.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: No, I'll not meddle.

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Pray you, go to him.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: What should I do?

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Only make trial what your love can do

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: For Rome, towards Marcius.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Well, and say that Marcius

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Return me, as Cominius is return'd,

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Unheard; what then?

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: But as a discontented friend, grief-shot

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: With his unkindness? say't be so?

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Yet your good will

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: must have that thanks from Rome, after the measure

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: As you intended well.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: I'll undertake 't:

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: I think he'll hear me. Yet, to bite his lip

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: And hum at good Cominius, much unhearts me.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: He was not taken well; he had not dined:

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: The veins unfill'd, our blood is cold, and then

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: We pout upon the morning, are unapt

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: To give or to forgive; but when we have stuff'd

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: These and these conveyances of our blood

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: With wine and feeding, we have suppler souls

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Than in our priest-like fasts: therefore I'll watch him

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Till he be dieted to my request,

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: And then I'll set upon him.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: You know the very road into his kindness,

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: And cannot lose your way.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Good faith, I'll prove him,

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Speed how it will. I shall ere long have knowledge

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Of my success.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Exit

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: He'll never hear him.

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Not?

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: I tell you, he does sit in gold, his eye

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Red as 'twould burn Rome; and his injury

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: The gaoler to his pity. I kneel'd before him;

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: 'Twas very faintly he said 'Rise;' dismiss'd me

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Thus, with his speechless hand: what he would do,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: He sent in writing after me; what he would not,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Bound with an oath to yield to his conditions:

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: So that all hope is vain.

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Unless his noble mother, and his wife;

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Who, as I hear, mean to solicit him

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: For mercy to his country. Therefore, let's hence,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: And with our fair entreaties haste them on.

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Exeunt
